instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Macbook A2337 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
PPBUS is also cycling Between 0V to 12.3V.

One Port - Amp Meter is Stable at 5V . PPBUS_AON is 11.99V
Another Port Amp Meter Rebooting . PPBUS_AON is 0V to 12.3V

No Liquid Damage. No Corossion

threads.title: Macbook A2337 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message: Compare diode mode readings between both ports.

threads.title: Macbook A2337 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
The CD321s and adjacent components have similar diode mode readings.

Diode Mode Reading
PP3v3_s2 is .330
PP1v25_s2 is .280

threads.title: Macbook A2337 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message: Both LDO's Diode mode readings are same. Since the master port (DFU) is rebooting the amp meter. Should we replace UF000?

threads.title: Macbook A2337 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
There must be a problem on USB-C area.
Both ports must have the same behavior.

I don't see any UF400/500 LDO reading posted.
Also compare CC1/2 lines.

threads.title: Macbook A2337 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
Diode Mode Readings to Ground

CF400 - .469
CF408 - .502
CF405 - .512

CF500 - .469
CF508 -.512
CF505 - .522

USBC0_CC1/2 -.590
USBC1_CC1/2 -.584

threads.title: Macbook A2337 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
One CD3217 chip may be bad.
You can also try flashing UF260.

threads.title: Macbook A2337 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message: Replaced Both CD3217 One by One. Still the same issue. Did replace the charging port as well.

threads.title: Macbook A2337 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message: Shouldn't PP1v25_S2 be .490 or something for diode mode reading to ground ? I am getting .280

threads.title: Macbook A2337 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
Injected 1V to check if anything was shirted. Nothing gets hot.
Its still the same

threads.title: Macbook A2337 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
Injecting 1V where?

Did you try reflashing UF260?
Replace with one from similar board, if available.

threads.title: Macbook A2337 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
Injected 1V in PP1v25_S2.

Should we replace UF260

threads.title: Macbook A2337 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
There is no short, just lower resistance than expected.
Injecting 1V into 0.280 doesn't help at all.

Reflash UF260, if you have correct dump.
Or replace it, if you can get one from same model board.
Make backup anyway.

threads.title: Macbook A2337 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
I just saw 0.280 as normal reading at 1V25_S2.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://openboarddata.org/?a=showboardsolutions&bpath=laptops/apple/820-02016[/URL]

You still have problems with one charging port.
Doesn't necessarily mean a bad CD3217 chip; may be a simple corroded resistor, or trace.

threads.title: Macbook A2337 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message: Any tips on how can i go about looking for it ?

threads.title: Macbook A2337 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
Check diode mode readings on all available components surrounding CD3217 chips.
Also compare on the USB-C connector pins.

threads.title: Macbook A2337 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
All seem fine. As per the openboarddata startup sequence mentioned.

ppvbus_usbc1 is pulsing from 0V to 5V because of the charging port reboot.
Anything there that you think we can try and replace ?

threads.title: Macbook A2337 Amp Meter Rebooting
threads.message:
CD3217 chips are very tricky to replace.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://logi.wiki/index.php/CD3217_and_T2_Power_on_Sequence[/URL]
